channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead adult fox, 8th June
item.description:
Dead adult fox in front garden of 61 Lennard Road just next to pavement. Probably hit by car and crawled to die

item.title: Overhanging tree on pavement outside number 74., 8th June
item.description:
Beverley Avenue has very little car parking space and the overhanging branches stop this space from being used for parking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Beverley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London

item.title: White mattress dumped in The Avenue, Beckenham, 8th June
item.description:
A white mattress was seen yesterday in the brick wall recess next to the pavement on the South side of The Avenue, opposite Redroofs Close and the block of flats which form No 5 The Avenue on the North side. Today I noticed the mattress has been moved to be propped up against a nearby plane tree, again on the South side of The Avenue. Please can it be removed - thanks!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Balloons stuck in wire / tree, 8th June
item.description:
A collection of helium party balloons are stuck on the telephone wire and tree branches. They have been there for weeks. Please remove.

item.title: Significant broken glass on pavement, 8th June
item.description:
Significant and hazardous amount of broken glass on pavement. Pedestrians have no alternative but to have to navigate across it on foot or step into the road. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hope Park, Plaistow, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 8th June
item.description:
Rubbish dumped on top end of broadwalk...again...towards well hall road...every other week we report fly tipping as these posters have been ripped off the wall. Please replace the posters and remove the rubbish as we had no fly tipping g when there were notices. It costs the council more to come and collect the rubbish than replace the signs!! This is my 3rd request

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broad Walk, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Discarded white rug, 8th June
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glenarm Road, Hackney, London
